newsitem.title: GERMANY: Two German soldiers killed in accident in Bosnia.
newsitem.headline: Two German soldiers killed in accident in Bosnia.

text.p: Two German soldiers taking part in the NATO-led peacekeeping force in Bosnia were killed in an accident on Friday at a German camp in Rajlovac near Sarajevo, the German Defence Ministry said.

A spokesman said two soldiers were killed and a third seriously injured when a 20-millimetre cannon mounted on a patrol vehicle fired off five or six shots and hit a transport vehicle parked in front of it. He said it was not yet known why the shots were fired.

About 3,300 German troops are based in Bosnia taking part in the NATO-led Stabilisation Force (SFOR). Some 31,000 troops in the NATO alliance and other countries are policing a Bosnian peace agreement in an 18-month mission due to expire this year.
The deployment of a 2,000-strong contingent of combat troops from Germany marked the first deployment abroad of German troops from combat formations since World War Two.

Equipped with armoured personnel carriers and reconnaissance vehicles, the soldiers are drawn from a Franco-German brigade in Germany and are working under French command in the southwest near the town of Mostar.
Germany has had few casualties in Bosnia. A 45-year-old soldier was found dead in his tent on May 15, believed to have died from natural causes.
